title: Program Design and Development
description: Fundamentals of problem solving and algorithm development using C/C++ with an emphasis on decomposition and testing.

title: Advanced Data Structures
description: Analysis and implementation of data structures including trees, hash tables, and graphs with applications in software design.

title: Introductory Cell Biology
description: Explores cellular structure, metabolism, genetics, and signaling with an applied laboratory component.

title: Calculus for Life Sciences
description: Differential and integral calculus applications for students in life sciences with emphasis on modeling.

title: Introductory Psychology
description: Survey of human behavior, cognition, and emotion with contemporary research examples.

title: College Composition
description: Focus on rhetorical strategies, critical reading, and revision to develop effective academic writing skills.

title: Roots of Contemporary Issues
description: Global historical themes shaping current issues with emphasis on primary sources and analytical writing.

title: Fundamentals of Microeconomics
description: Introduction to microeconomic theory covering supply and demand, market structures, and consumer behavior.

title: Organic Chemistry I
description: Structure, nomenclature, reactions, and mechanisms of organic compounds with laboratory applications.

title: Introduction to GIScience
description: Foundations of geographic information systems, spatial analysis, and cartographic design using modern GIS tools.

title: Nursing Pharmacology
description: Pharmacological principles for nursing practice with emphasis on safe medication administration and patient education.
